text: I'm somebody who doesn't work with a stylist. I'll be honest with you, I'm a mom and it's just not something I want to put money toward because it's expensive to have somebody who helps dress you and I feel like I have to pay for preschool and so many things... so I don't have a stylist.
author: Busy Philipps

text: Mom always tells me to celebrate everyone's uniqueness. I like the way that sounds.
author: Hilary Duff

text: My mom taught me not to talk about money.
author: Hilary Duff

text: I love my mom. I totally look up to her, and she just doesn't let anybody take advantage of me. People might call that a stage mom.
author: Hilary Duff

text: My relationship with my mom is so amazing. We never got to have that stage that people go through, like when you're 13 and you think you're too cool for your parents. When you're embarrassed by them and stuff. We never went through that because I was constantly working and she constantly had to be there.
author: Hilary Duff
